pr_title: Sb bazel muliple rule types off master

timeline.message: Release 6.4.0-SIGQA1
Using the next snapshot post release 6.4.0-SIGQA2-SNAPSHOT
feat(bazel): enable collection of dependencies from multiple repository rule types; previously existing tests pass
test(bazel): added test for detecting multiple supported rules in a workspace file
test(bazel): added test for mixed-repo-rule build target scenario
fix(bazel): use cquery in first maven_jar query
fix(bazel): fixes related to running w/ multiple rules, some of which don't apply
style(doc): update bazel doc for change to cquery for maven_jar
fix(bazel): improved error reporting from bazel command failures
refactor(bazel): refactoring
test(bazel): added WorkspaceRuleChooser tests for multi-rule capability
test(bazel): Cleanup
feat(bazel): adding support for ALL and NONE to bazel dependency type
refactor(bazel): clean up rule chooser
test(bazel): refactoring test
fix(bazel): Eliminate UNSPECIFIED choice for bazel dependency type, since NONE is now available
refactor(bazel): make better use of FilterableEnumUtils
fix(bazel): Fix for the ALL rules case
refactor(bazel): remove unused code

Merge branch 'sb_bazelMultipleRuleTypes' into sb_bazelMulipleRuleTypesOffMaster

# Conflicts:
#	build.gradle
refactor(bazel): naming
refactor(bazel): Limit the complexity of FilterableEnumValue to BazelDetectableOptions (deal with it there, not in WorkspaceRuleChooser).
Merge branch 'master' into sb_bazelMulipleRuleTypesOffMaster
refactor(bazel): sonar code smell cleanup
feat: Converted DetectableOptionFactory to java

timeline.bodyText: I think this work should move to the configuration factory - imo options shouldn't have logic, they are POJO and should be constructed in a valid state. This would let detectable not need to know about FilterableEnumValue - the configuration just converts that to the appropriate Set and creates a valid option object.
timeline.author: taikuukaits

replies.bodyText: I moved it to DetectableOptionFactory... is that what you meant?
replies.author: stevebillings

timeline.bodyText: I think extractors should be tested in a battery test - the size of this test and the amount of mocking needed makes this test difficult to follow and it seems like a good candidate for a battery test. I wouldn't mind discussing this kind of test at large but this to me is what the battery is for.
timeline.author: taikuukaits

replies.bodyText: Moved to a new battery test
replies.author: stevebillings

timeline.message: test(bazel): added first test in new bazel battery test
test(bazel): battery now covers maven_install and haskell_cabal_library
refactor(bazel): sonar code smells
test: battery: template fix for case where a command is run multiple times
test(bazel): added battery test for maven_jar
test(bazel): added battery test for ALL rule types
test(bazel): removed BazelExtractorTest, now replaced by battery tests
merge from master
refactor(bazel): Simplified BazelWorkspace.
refactor(bazel): remove temp change
test(gomod): fix expected results for gomod test

Merge pull request #204 from blackducksoftware/jake-bazel

refactor(bazel): Simplified BazelWorkspace.
feat: Deleted kotlin DetectableOptionFactory, replaced usages with Java version
merge from master
Merge commit 'f50b8ea533e0d34e5b3ea76975a84c081af46493' into sb_bazelMulipleRuleTypesOffMaster
refactor(bazel): moved FilterableEnumValue complexity for workspace rule property from BazelDetectableOptions to DetectableOptionFactory.
test(bazel): added tests for optionsFactory translation of user input (List<FilterableEnumValue<WorkspaceRule>> ) to a Set of WorkspaceRules
test(bazel): address sonar code smells
Merge branch 'master' into sb_bazelMulipleRuleTypesOffMaster
